title: attitudes
comment: The ways in which people think or feel about something or someone and which affect their behaviour.

children.title: attitudes, God's to people
children.comment: Scripture indicates the ways in which God relates to people, often suggesting that these illustrate the ways in which believers should behave.

children.title: attitudes, positive to God
children.comment: Scripture identifies a range of positive attitudes towards God, which believers are encouraged to adopt.

children.title: attitudes, negative to God
children.comment: Scripture identifies a range of negative attitudes towards God, which believers are encouraged to avoid.

children.title: attitudes, to other people
children.comment: Scripture illustrates a range of attitudes towards other people, some of which are commended, while others are condemned.

children.title: attitudes, to life
children.comment: The way in which people think or feel about human life is of major importance to morality. Scripture declares the sanctity of life, and the attitudes towards life which should follow.

children.title: attitudes, in prayer
children.comment: Attitudes in prayer include both the postures people adopt while praying and the hopes that they have concerning its outcome. Scripture points to the need for humility and expectation on the part of those who pray.

children.title: Falling on one's face before God
